name: Noi's Thai Kitchen
highlights: Authentic Bangkok street food, plastic tables, loud and bustling
details: Family-run spot serving real-deal Thai street food. No frills, just incredible pad thai and green curry.
editorial_summary: The closest you'll get to Bangkok in Maui

vibe.vibe_summary: Bustling, no-frills Thai spot with plastic outdoor seating and authentic Bangkok night market energy. Loud, casual, and unapologetically real.

name: Mama's Fish House
highlights: Iconic oceanfront dining, fresh catch daily, special occasion destination
details: Legendary Maui institution since 1973. Each dish lists the fisherman who caught it. Tiki-elegant atmosphere with toes-in-sand romance.
editorial_summary: The most famous restaurant in Hawaii for a reason

vibe.vibe_summary: Iconic oceanfront fine dining with tiki-elegant decor. Romantic, special-occasion energy where you can feel the sand between your toes while dining on the freshest catch in Hawaii.

name: Tin Roof Maui
highlights: Chef Sheldon Simeon's casual counter-service spot, poke bowls, local plates
details: Top Chef finalist's takeout window serving elevated local comfort food. Line out the door but worth the wait.
editorial_summary: Celebrity chef quality at plate lunch prices

vibe.vibe_summary: No-frills counter-service spot from a Top Chef finalist. Grab-and-go energy with serious culinary chops. Expect a line but the mochiko chicken is worth it.

name: Merriman's Kapalua
highlights: Farm-to-table pioneer, stunning sunset views, sophisticated island cuisine
details: Peter Merriman helped define Hawaii Regional Cuisine. Elegant but not stuffy, with jaw-dropping Kapalua Bay views.
editorial_summary: Where farm-to-table meets ocean views

vibe.vibe_summary: Sophisticated farm-to-table dining with spectacular Kapalua Bay sunset views. Elevated but approachable—dress nice but leave the jacket at home.

name: Da Kitchen
highlights: Massive plate lunches, loco moco, local comfort food
details: The quintessential Hawaiian plate lunch experience. Portions are enormous. Come hungry, leave happy.
editorial_summary: Authentic Hawaiian comfort food in massive portions

vibe.vibe_summary: Classic Hawaiian plate lunch joint with portions that could feed a family. Loud, friendly, and totally unpretentious. The loco moco is legendary.

name: Lahaina Grill
highlights: Award-winning fine dining, sophisticated atmosphere, impeccable service
details: Consistently rated Maui's best restaurant. White tablecloths, extensive wine list, and dishes that are works of art.
editorial_summary: Maui's most acclaimed fine dining experience

vibe.vibe_summary: White-tablecloth fine dining at its best. Hushed, romantic atmosphere with impeccable service. This is where you go when you want to feel fancy.

name: Paia Fish Market
highlights: Fresh fish tacos, casual beach town vibe, surfer hangout
details: Order at the counter, grab a picnic table, and enjoy the freshest fish tacos on the island. Surfers, tourists, and locals all mix here.
editorial_summary: The perfect post-beach fish taco spot

vibe.vibe_summary: Quintessential beach town fish market with picnic table seating. Sandy feet welcome. The fish tacos are legendary and the vibe is pure aloha.

name: Sansei Seafood
highlights: Award-winning sushi, creative rolls, late-night happy hour
details: Inventive Japanese-fusion that's been winning awards for decades. The late-night 50% off sushi deal is legendary.
editorial_summary: Creative sushi with a cult-following late-night scene

vibe.vibe_summary: Buzzy Japanese-fusion spot known for creative rolls and an epic late-night happy hour. Social, fun atmosphere that gets lively after 10pm.

name: Kula Lodge
highlights: Stunning upcountry views, cozy mountain lodge, breakfast destination
details: Perched on the slopes of Haleakala with panoramic views. Cozy lodge atmosphere with a fireplace. Famous for breakfast.
editorial_summary: Mountain lodge charm with views for days

vibe.vibe_summary: Cozy mountain lodge with fireplace and sweeping upcountry views. Peaceful, romantic escape from the beach crowds. Perfect for a lazy breakfast.

name: Star Noodle
highlights: Shareable Asian plates, craft cocktails, industrial-chic space
details: From the Merriman's team, a modern take on Asian comfort food. Order lots of small plates and share everything.
editorial_summary: Hip Asian fusion with a share-everything philosophy

vibe.vibe_summary: Industrial-chic space with communal tables and a share-everything menu. Trendy, social atmosphere perfect for adventurous eaters who like to try a bit of everything.

name: Leoda's Kitchen
highlights: Famous pies, comfort food, roadside charm
details: Roadside pie shop and kitchen between Lahaina and Maalaea. The banana cream pie is life-changing. Great lunch stop.
editorial_summary: Roadside gem famous for life-changing pies

vibe.vibe_summary: Charming roadside kitchen with counter service and picnic tables. Come for the comfort food, stay for the legendary pies. Perfect pit stop between adventures.

name: Monkeypod Kitchen
highlights: Craft cocktails, live music, cream pies, lively atmosphere
details: Peter Merriman's casual concept. Great happy hour, live music most nights, and those famous cream pies.
editorial_summary: Where farm-to-table meets island party vibes

vibe.vibe_summary: Buzzy, social restaurant with live music and a party atmosphere. Great for groups who want good food without taking themselves too seriously. Happy hour is legendary.

name: Hana Ranch Restaurant
highlights: Only sit-down restaurant in Hana, ranch-raised beef, remote paradise
details: At the end of the Road to Hana, this is your reward. Simple, honest food in one of the most remote spots in Hawaii.
editorial_summary: Your delicious reward at the end of the Road to Hana

vibe.vibe_summary: Remote, peaceful restaurant at the end of the Road to Hana. Simple ranch food in a setting that feels like the edge of the world. Pure, unhurried aloha.

name: Cafe Des Amis
highlights: Crepes, curries, bohemian Paia vibe, great for vegetarians
details: Eclectic Mediterranean-Indian spot in the heart of bohemian Paia. Excellent vegetarian options and people-watching.
editorial_summary: Bohemian crepes and curries in hippie-chic Paia

vibe.vibe_summary: Bohemian cafe with sidewalk seating in the heart of hippie Paia. Eclectic menu, great for vegetarians, and perfect for watching the colorful Paia scene go by.

name: Ferraro's Bar e Ristorante
highlights: Oceanfront Italian, Four Seasons elegance, sunset views
details: Four Seasons restaurant right on the beach. Impeccable Italian cuisine with your toes practically in the sand. Ultimate romantic splurge.
editorial_summary: Four Seasons elegance meets beachfront Italian

vibe.vibe_summary: Beachfront Italian elegance at the Four Seasons. White tablecloths meet sandy toes. The ultimate romantic sunset dinner—splurge-worthy in every way.

name: Coconut's Fish Cafe
highlights: Best fish tacos in Kihei, casual counter service, local favorite
details: Tiny counter-service spot with a cult following. The fish tacos are perfectly simple and perfectly delicious.
editorial_summary: No-frills fish tacos that locals swear by

vibe.vibe_summary: Tiny, no-frills fish taco spot that locals fiercely protect. Counter service, plastic forks, and some of the best fish tacos on the island. No pretense, just perfection.

name: Mala Ocean Tavern
highlights: Oceanfront dining, sustainable seafood, great brunch
details: Casual-upscale spot right on the water. Known for sustainable practices and a killer weekend brunch with ocean views.
editorial_summary: Sustainable seafood with waves crashing below

vibe.vibe_summary: Relaxed oceanfront spot where you can hear the waves while you eat. Upscale but not stuffy, with a strong commitment to sustainability. Brunch here is magic.

name: Tasty Crust
highlights: Old-school diner, famous pancakes, local institution since 1944
details: Time-capsule diner that's been serving locals since 1944. The pancakes are legendary. Cash only, no frills, pure nostalgia.
editorial_summary: Step back in time at this 1944 pancake institution

vibe.vibe_summary: Time-warp diner unchanged since 1944. Formica counters, local regulars, and pancakes that justify the hype. Cash only, attitude optional, authenticity guaranteed.

name: Spago Maui
highlights: Wolfgang Puck's Maui outpost, celebrity chef dining, stunning views
details: Wolfgang Puck brings his California-Hawaiian fusion to the Four Seasons. Impeccable food, celebrity sightings possible, views that never get old.
editorial_summary: Wolfgang Puck's island paradise

vibe.vibe_summary: Wolfgang Puck's glamorous Maui outpost at the Four Seasons. Sophisticated, see-and-be-seen energy with food that lives up to the celebrity chef hype.

name: Ululani's Hawaiian Shave Ice
highlights: Award-winning shave ice, homemade syrups, perfect on a hot day
details: Not just any shave ice—this is the shave ice. Homemade syrups, perfect texture, and flavors that will ruin you for all other shave ice forever.
editorial_summary: The shave ice that will ruin all other shave ice for you

vibe.vibe_summary: The most famous shave ice in Hawaii, and it earns every bit of hype. Colorful, fun, and absolutely essential on a hot Maui day. Expect a line—it moves fast.
